column1: Chajarí is a city in the northeast of the province of Entre Ríos
column2: Argentina. It has 45.000 inhabitants per the 2010 census [INDEC]
column3: and it is the largest city in the Federación Department. It lies on Provincial Route 2
column4: about 2 km east of the intersection with National Route 14 and west of the Salto Grande reservoir on the Uruguay River
column5: 330 km from the provincial capital Paraná.

column1: The settlement of Chajarí was populated after joint efforts of the provincial and national governments to encourage colonization. The original town
column3: was founded on 28 May 1872; colonists began arriving in 1876 from several regions of Europe. The municipal government was established in 1889
column4: and in 1934 the town changed its name to match that of its railway station

column2: like many other towns and cities in the east of Entre Ríos
column3: and in September 2001 it opened facilities for visitors interested in the therapeutic properties of its waters. It also has a camping site by the artificial Salto Grande lake
column5: which can be used for fishing and water sports.
